title: French colonization of the Americas
summary: The French colonization of the Americas (French: Colonisation française des Amériques) began in the 16th century and continued on into the following centuries as France established a colonial empire in the Western Hemisphere. France established colonies in much of eastern North America, on a number of Caribbean islands, and in South America. Most colonies were developed to export products such as fish, rice, sugar, and furs.
